intro: Capsella rhenana, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous species. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–50 centimeters, with hairy stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
